title: Olivia Wilde is striking in full-length blue tye dye dress as she's honored at SCAD Film Festival
text:
Her directorial debut Booksmart, released earlier this year, has been widely praised.

And on Tuesday night, Olivia Wilde was presented with the Savannah College of Art and Design Rising Star Director Award during its annual film festival.

For the occasion, the actress, 35, wore a striking blue tye dye dress.

Honored with award: Olivia Wilde was feted at the Savannah College of Art and Design Film Festival Tuesday night in Georgia

Her chosen outfit had a collar, bell sleeves and buttons down the front.

The full-length dress was belted at the waist and featured a tye dye statement buckle.

Wilde wore her long hair straight and sleek and tucked behind her ears which were adorned with diamond stud earrings.

She added dramatic purple and black eye makeup and glossy lip color and carried a white box clutch.

Striking: For the occasion, the actress wore a blue tye dye dress with a collar, bell sleeves and buttons down the front. It was belted at the waist and featured a tye dye statement buckle

In the spotlight: Wilde wore her long hair straight and sleek and tucked behind her ears which were adorned with diamond stud earrings

Trophy: Wilde was presented with the festival's Rising Star Director Award for her feature directorial debut Booksmart, which was released in theatres last May

In an interview with Variety, Wilde praised the film festival circuit for embracing female filmmakers.

'It feels like female filmmakers are taking up more space,' she said.

'We’re still only 15% of the Directors Guild, which has to change, but festivals are really where you see the shift beginning to happen,' she added.

This past weekend, Wilde, who shares two children with Jason Sudeikis, responded on Twitter to reports that an airline had edited out a kissing scene between the two female stars of Booksmart.

The original tweet read: 'Tried watching Booksmart on the plane and they cut the ENTIRE lesbian hookup scene like not even a KISS was allowed! Oh but don’t worry guys, the Straights got their kiss.'

Wilde responded: 'This is truly a bummer, There is no nudity in this scene. What makes it too obscene for airplane viewing? What airline?'

Same sex moment: This past weekend, Wilde learned via a Twitter user that an airline had edited out a kissing scene between the two female stars of Booksmart

'Truly a bummer': She made her feelings known in a response she tweeted out and subsequently told Variety: 'I don't understand it. My heart just broke'

She expanded on her feelings when asked about it at the Academy's Governors Awards in Los Angeles on Sunday night.

The scene in question is between actresses Kaitlyn Dever and Beanie Feldstein who play two straight-laced, academic achieving high school students who embark on a night of thrill-seeking ahead of graduation.

'It's such an integral part of this character's journey,' Wilde told Variety of the scene. 'I don't understand it. My heart just broke.'
